p:
Serum and peripheral blood mononuclear cell samples were also collected from individuals who were diagnosed with MERS coronavirus infection during the 2015 Korean outbreak. Convalescent samples were obtained at a mean of 19·8 months (SD 0·7) from MERS diagnosis. Acute phase serum samples from the time of initial admission to hospital, collected a mean of 20·8 days (14·3) from diagnosis and 25·1 days (15·1) from symptom onset, were available in small volumes from each participant. Samples were analysed using the same methods as vaccine sample testing. Serological immune responses for some of the individuals have been previously reported following acute infection
18 and 1 year after infection.
